items.abstract: <jats:p>It was found when examining typical herbary material that <em>Camelina</em> sativa a pilosa DC. is a synonym, of C. microcarpa Andrz.. subsp. silvestris (Wallr.) Hiit. and C. pilosa (DC:) Zing. Q=C. sativa (L.) Cr. subsp. pilosa (DC.) Zing.) belongs to C. sativa (L.) Cr. s.l.. Therefore the name of C. pilosa (DC.) Zing. as based on the alien type should be rejected and the author suggests in its place the name of C. sativa (L.) Cr. var. Zingeri Mirek vas. nova.</jats:p>
title: Taxonomy and nomenclature of Camelina pilosa auct.

items.abstract: <jats:p>This study is on an endemic species of Polish flora, known until now as <em>Gladiolus parviflorus</em> Berdau (<em>Iridaceae</em>). Due to the existence of two earlier homonyms, a new species name for this taxon is proposed - <em>Gladiolus felicis</em>. The position, range and rank of this enigmatic taxon are discussed on the basis of biometric studies. The localization of all of its stands known until now is presented.</jats:p>
title: Studies on Polish endemic species -vascular plants. 1. Gladiolus felicis Mirek nom, novum (=G. parviflorus Berdau nom. illeg.)

items.abstract: <jats:p>The paper gives detailed morphological description, geographical distribution and some other information on <em>Camelina anomala</em>. Boiss. et Hausskn. In the literature the species has not been characterized precisely.</jats:p>
title: Monographic studies in genus Camelina Cr. 1. Camelina anomala Boiss. et Hausskn.

title: Roth's theorem in the Piatetski-Shapiro primes

items.abstract: <jats:p>The revision of the Stodółkiewicz's Monte-Carlo code is presented. It treats each<jats:italic>superstar</jats:italic>as a single star and follows the evolution and motion of all individual stellar objects. The first calculations, for equalmass<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>-body systems with three-body energy generation accordingly to Spitzer's formulae, show good agreement with the direct<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>-body calculations for<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>= 2000 and 10000 particles.</jats:p>
title: Monte-Carlo Simulations

reference.volume-title: Dynamical Evolution of Globular Clusters
The Use of Supercomputers in Stellar Dynamics
Dynamics of Stellar Systems
Dynamics of Stellar Systems

items.abstract: <jats:p>The first results of Monte Carlo simulations of the evolution of tidally limited, multi-mass million star clusters with stellar evolution and dynamically formed binaries are presented.</jats:p>

title: Scaling in soil physics: principles and applications

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Scaling of flow phenomena in circulating fluidized bed boilers</jats:title>
        <jats:p>The paper presents an overview of scaling models used for determining hydrodynamic parameters of Circulating Fluidized Bed boilers. The governing equations and the corresponding dimensionless numbers are derived and presented for three different approaches to the scaling law of fluidized beds: classical dimensional analysis, differential equations and integrated solutions and experimental correlations. Some results obtained with these equations are presented. Finally, the capabilities and limitations of scaling experiments are discussed.</jats:p>
title: Scaling of flow phenomena in circulating fluidized bed boilers
